physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The photograph shows an arch which is curved inwards in a concave manner. There are geometric motifs along the underside of the arch
 in a single line. It is made up of a smaller eight sided symmetrical figure being superimposed on the same symmetrical figure
 albeit a larger one. Each figure occupies has a square border. There are no visible cracks on the arch.
subject_terms_1:railroad stations historic monuments Art Deco Neoclassical arches geometric motifs
subject_terms_2:Black-and-white photography Historic monuments Railroad stations Art deco (Architecture) Neoclassicism (Architecture) Arches Motifs Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Tanjong Pagar (Singapore)
subject_terms_3:Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Photography Rail transport (Stations)
sgcool_label_text:\This image shows an arch from the building of the Tanjong Pagar railway station. The station was known for its Art Deco and neo-classical architectural styles. Designed by Swan and Maclaren
 the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the \\Tracking Memories\\ collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore

metadata.creator_2: Kwek Leng Joo Swan and Maclaren Architects
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The photograph shows an arch which is curved inwards in a concave manner. There are geometric motifs along the underside of the arch, in a single line. It is made up of a smaller eight sided symmetrical figure being superimposed on the same symmetrical figure, albeit a larger one. Each figure occupies has a square border. There are no visible cracks on the arch.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This image shows an arch from the building of the Tanjong Pagar railway station. The station was known for its Art Deco and neo-classical architectural styles. Designed by Swan and Maclaren, the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the ""Tracking Memories"" collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore
